stix:STIX_Header.stix:Title: Analysis of Malicious Email Attachments
stix:STIX_Header.stix:Description:
On 08 November 2013, a number of malicious files were submitted for analysis. Based on similar indicators it is suspected these were initially delivered as malicious attachments to email. Four of the files dropped a near identical copy of itself. Each of these performed HTTP GET requests for second stage downloads. One of the files made a HTTP GET request for a file that did not have an executable extension, and the file was not available at the time of analysis.
This product incorporates data originally published in MIFR-325409.

stix:Indicator.indicator:Description:
Upon execution "fax0101_08102013.exe" (MD5: 7f4b84a40a7e5f6f6fab9a2aa277c815) creates "demka.exe" (MD5: e7d9577a1c46333c4004981e783fbe4d) in the %TEMP% directory. The dropper (MD5: 7f4b84a40a7e5f6f6fab9a2aa277c815) is then deleted by the dropped file (MD5: e7d9577a1c46333c4004981e783fbe4d).
Section Hashes: 01de4db7baddc3afac47500c4c563c36 (header) 1024 a21a043ae9b7a274d215ac3a155e78bf .text 11264 062610d23886e7c33d5b2b77fda62e86 .data 3584 831713098c40738b11b89fe574ff1090 .rsrc 10752

This file performs registry modifications that adds and deletes networking settings. It generates SSL HTTP GET traffic to "ttms.org" to download a file over remote port 443 from the following URL. https://ttms.org/config/UKo8.exe
This file is a copy of the dropper file (MD5: 7f4b84a40a7e5f6f6fab9a2aa277c815). Using ssdeep for file comparison yields a 100% fuzzy hash match. Additionally, reviewing the section hashes of both files reveal that they both contain the same data since the individual section hashes match.
This file modifies the value of the following registry keys: HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Internet Settings\MigrateProxy HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Internet Settings\ProxyEnable HKLM\SYSTEM\ControlSet001\Hardware Profiles\0001\Software\Microsoft\windows\CurrentVersion\Internet Settings\ProxyEnable
This file deletes the following registry keys: HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Internet Settings\ProxyServer HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Internet Settings\ProxyOverride HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Internet Settings\AutoConfigURL
Section Hashes: 01de4db7baddc3afac47500c4c563c36 (header) 1024 a21a043ae9b7a274d215ac3a155e78bf .text 11264 062610d23886e7c33d5b2b77fda62e86 .data 3584 831713098c40738b11b89fe574ff1090 .rsrc 10752
The file with (MD5: e7d9577a1c46333c4004981e783fbe4d) generates SSL HTTP GET requests for this URL.

This file (MD5: 0798687a993b98ebf5e87a6f78311f32) is a "Downloader/Dropper". Upon execution, "hhcbrnaff.exe" (MD5: 79277c88c1fe3edf51cd2cbb36b0ff5a) was created in the %TEMP% directory. This file (MD5: 0798687a993b98ebf5e87a6f78311f32) gets deleted by the dropped file (MD5: 79277c88c1fe3edf51cd2cbb36b0ff5a).
This file modifies the value of the following registry keys: HKU\S-1-5-21-[varies}\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Internet Settings\Connections\DefaultConnectionSettings HKU\S-1-5-21-[varies]\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Internet Settings\Connections\SavedLegacySettings HKLM\SYSTEM\ControlSet001\Hardware Profiles\0001\Software\Microsoft\windows\CurrentVersion\Internet Settings\ProxyEnable HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Internet Settings\MigrateProxy HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Internet Settings\ProxyEnable
This file deletes the following registry keys: HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Internet Settings\ProxyServer HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Internet Settings\ProxyOverride HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Internet Settings\AutoConfigURL
Section Hashes: 5ba4f33c74f0168b0189d62776992ec3 (header) 1024 794d2e5cd2c84488fb4478411a865d16 .text 2048 ca01b09c75e4cbda5497e69c5fb1bf5d .data 5120 b46e443ecb8d3a0a6f231d465e28fd9f .idata 3072 ac8da3d5b16788a1238c52274966965e .rsrc 12288

This file (MD5: 79277c88c1fe3edf51cd2cbb36b0ff5a) is a 99% ssdeep fuzzy hash match with the file that dropped it (MD5: 0798687a993b98ebf5e87a6f78311f32). This file (MD5: 79277c88c1fe3edf51cd2cbb36b0ff5a) generates SSL HTTP GET requests for "lasub-hasta.com" to download the file from remote port 443 at this URL. https://lasub-hasta.com/hasta/ho7.exe
In addition to the file "h07.exe" the file name hhgnrddkjee.exe was found in ASCII strings in the file (MD5: 79277c88c1fe3edf51cd2cbb36b0ff5a).
Section Hashes: 5ba4f33c74f0168b0189d62776992ec3 (header) 1024 794d2e5cd2c84488fb4478411a865d16 .text 2048 ca01b09c75e4cbda5497e69c5fb1bf5d .data 5120 b46e443ecb8d3a0a6f231d465e28fd9f .idata 3072 ac8da3d5b16788a1238c52274966965e .rsrc 12288
The file (MD5: 79277c88c1fe3edf51cd2cbb36b0ff5a) generates SSL HTTP GET requests for this URL.

Upon execution, this malware generates HTTP GET request for the following URL, communicating with destination port 80: http://195.137.188.89/ld/stat.dat
This malware is able to silently register DLLs from the command line. The malware sets a registry key to allow it to persist across reboots.
The malware checks to see if the following antivirus solutions are installed on the system. -Malwarebytes' Anti-Malware -Malwarebytes -Positive Technologies -Sandboxie -Microsoft Security Essentials -Microsoft Microsoft Antimalware -DefenseWall -DefenseWall HIPS -BlockPost -Lavasoft -Spyware Terminator -Zillya Antivirus -Security Task Manager -FRISK Software -Sunbelt Software -Vba32 -K7 omputing -P Tools Internet Security -G DATA -Internet Security -f-secure -Common Files\Doctor Web -Doctor Web -avg8 -a-squared HiJackFree -a-squared Anti-Malware -Common Files\Symantec Shared -Xore -AVG -Symantec -Alwil Software -AnVir Task Manager -Online Solutions -ArcaBit -BitDefender -Trend Micro -McAfee.com -McAfee -Panda Security -Agnitum -ESET -Norton AntiVirus -DrWeb -Kaspersky Lab Setup Files -Kaspersky Lab -Avira -Avira GmbH -AVAST Software
